title: Starcross to Powderham Castle Walk Route

images.title: Derek Harper / Breakwater, Starcross
images.caption: Breakwater, Starcross. On the right is the pontoon at the end of the jetty, where the Exmouth ferry leaves. Across the estuary are scattered buildings in SX9983 to the south of Lympstone.

images.title: Estuary of the River Exe by David Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Estuary of the River Exe

images.title: Sheila Russell / Powderham Castle from the Exe
images.caption: Powderham Castle from the Exe. The staircase, hall, music room and master bedroom of the house were used as locations for the 1993 film The Remains of the Day starring Anthony Hopkins and Emma Thompson.

images.title: Powderham House and belvedere by Derek Harper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Powderham House and belvedere

images.title: Stags at Powderham by Derek Harper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Derek Harper / Footpath to Kenton
images.caption: Footpath to Kenton. Looking along Kenton Footpath 1 from near its junction with Kenton Footpath 10, with the tower of All Saints Church in the centre, behind housing on Orchard Way.

images.title: Martinevans123, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Powderham Castle from the Rose Garden, southeast

images.title: Nilfanion, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The lake and trees in autumn

description: This circular walk takes you from Starcross to Powderham Castle and the village of Kenton. There's fine views over the Exe Estuary and a lovely deer park to explore on this varied route. The walk starts on the Exe Estuary at Starcross train station. Here you can pick up the Exe Valley Way and follow it north along the river to Powderham Sands. You then turn west and then south to visit the castle and expansive deer park. The manor house dates back to the 14th century and is a Grade I listed building. There are beautiful grounds and gardens to explore here. The route then follows a footpath south west into Kenton, crossing the River Kenn as you go. From Kenton you can follow some quiet country lanes south east to Witcombe and Starcross.
